headline: Great summer experience
pros:
+Great range of projects
+Well organized legal activities
+Company has great educational resources
+location is great! and so is company cafeteria
cons:
-Person I interned under was crazy - I spent most of my time with her. I'm fairly certain she was subsequently fired.
-Company doesn't hire from intern pool (that's why I gave it 3 stars for career opportunities - it'd def be higher if I worked there full time)
-Lots of down time - again, may be related to crazy boss.

headline: Great people with terrible moral
pros: The scientists and engineers who work there are extremely professional and care about their job. The science and engineering is excellent. Compensation and benefits have always been good.
cons: At some point, the accountants apparently became the most important people in the company as short term monetary implications always seem to trump long-term progress or goals. Despite an increasing workload, the mantra always seems to be "do more with less." The employees have been enduring a constant stream on mergers and layoffs, seemingly every year. The company is positioning itself to be broken apart. Benefits have been slashed over the past couple of years. Outside of contractors, few new employees seemed to be hired every year.

headline: Experience at Pfizer
pros: Huge company with a lot of possibilities
cons: The company has to many lay offs

headline: Work-life balance
pros: Highly dynamic environment with constant change, from business deals to business unit restructuring
cons: Very difficult to maintain work-life balance.  Attitude of management is to 'do more with less'

headline: Great benefits and work-life balance
pros: Pay is good and benefits are excellent.  For example, when I worked at Pfizer, they implemented a new policy at the site for a 6-week paid PATERNITY leave.  Unreal. I started out with 3 weeks of paid vacation plus most holidays were paid.  If you did work on a holiday, you were compensated very well, usually double-time pay. They are flexible regarding lay-offs in my experience.  The site at which I worked closed, but they offered to transfer me to another site or give me a severance package.
cons: Not too many complaints that I can think of.  It was the best job I have ever had.  I did get a little bored which motivated me to move on to graduate school.

headline: Great Job
pros: Great pay. Great Benefits, Bonuses. Tuition Reimbursement , Matching 401(K), Overtime, plenty of benefits, safe environment, a lot of holidays are recognized‚Ä¶etc
cons: Forced overtime for those who didn't want it or had other obligations, management overlooks regular employees, depending on where you work the rules are totally different, the environment can feel confining depending on where you work

headline: Pfizer needs to reinvent itself
pros: There are so many resources at your disposal. We have people that do everything in every walk of life and have agencies for everything.
cons: But no one knows how to use any of the resources very well and it's so big there is no ownership. There is no one to compare yourself to and it's not challenging work. At many times it's like herding sheep.

headline: Great company culture and place to work
pros: Great company culture and place to work
cons: Sometimes difficult to get things done because the company is so large

headline: about Pfizer...
pros: A good company to work for...
cons: difficult to go up the ladder

headline: Challenging and enjoyable place to work if you can get used to the ever changing territories and managers
pros: Pfizer provides great benefits and salary.  During my time I have had multiple managers and territories and each has brought challenges, but overall I would say it has been a great company to work for if you can handle regular change.
cons: Pfizer, like many pharma companies today, has had multiple layoffs and restructurings.  This can make for a stressful work environment.

headline: One of the best companies to work for
pros: Good environment within its colleagues
cons: No opportunities to work in another location within same region

headline: Capitalism at its worst !!!
pros: Great People and nice facilities !!
cons: The bottom line seems to be the only concern on this company above all. Everything is gear towards driving profits and increasing the bottom line to satisfy their greed. No great salaries !!

headline: Great benefits, relaxed culture however career progression can be slow, but depends on which department you are in.
pros: Benefits and pay are above average.  Good people, relaxed and flexible approach to work.
cons: Sometimes the pace is a little too slow, then all of a sudden everything is urgent.

headline: No Long term Career planning
pros: Good compensation & benefits. Good place for old timers.
cons: Continuous restructuring. No long term career planning. No job security.

headline: it was a great experience
pros: learning curve is steep and they actually give you responsibility so that you work hard. they have free breakfast and lunch and the location of the company is great. workers are very young and successful
cons: I did not like my product manager so it became such a terrible time for me. moreover, interns who worked with different people did less job than i did but they all got to interview for fulltime. my product manager was no help in that sense. they are changing their departments so they will lay off a lot of people

headline: The most exciting think to work at Pfizer is to make impact in other people lives.
pros: Great benefits, great history, great resources...
cons: Too many changes are not allowing professional growth, not a clear future.

headline: Good company gone bad.
pros: Quality of leadership and managers declined within the company.
cons: Sales not valued by company

headline: fefer said the company now has 20 employees, and is outsourcing the manufacturing as well as clinical trials. According
pros: resent at the 2013 AAPS Annual Meeting and Exposition. "Mucus-Penetrating Particles for Enhanced Ophthalmic Delivery" Mini-Symposium "Moving beyond Simple Eyedrops: Novel Delivery Methods for Topical
cons: trial will be in patients with post-operative inflammation and pain following cataract surgery. has reformulated a drug called loteprednol etabonate, which is normally administered as an ointment to be applied four times a day.

headline: Challenging work in a dynamic environment
pros:
Professional, hard working employees.  
Company core values are aimed at the development of treatments that provide a better quality of life to our consumers.
cons: Dynamic industry does not lend to job security.

headline: Top Pharmaceutical company
pros: Manage your own territory and set your own hours
cons: Currently the healthcare environment is challenging

headline: Great Company!
pros: Benefits, great pay, great training
cons: At the mercy of the viability of the drug, however Pfizer always seems to have quality products.

headline: Eye opening experience into the world of a major drug company.
pros: Excellent health coverage and exposure to meeting very smart individuals.  Working at Pfizer felt like you were a part of a major movement in the health industry and that your work was important to that movement.  The amount of talent at Pfizer was palpable in the beginning years at Pfizer and it felt amazing to be a part of such a group.  Towards the later years the group was still the same but the passion and level of expertise just seemed to fizzle and not evolve.  Although the company was constantly changing vision and missions the team members continued their old methods and procedures - and complained the whole way through when changes were implemented.
cons: No room for professional growth both upward or lateral from an administrative position.  The administrative professionals were not given the opportunity to demonstrate knowledge or talent within or outside the realms of their roles and responsibilities.  There is a lot of skills and talents wasted on a administrative level.

headline: Director, Worldwide Technology
pros: Great people, challenging work in an interesting field
cons: So much change, tough to keep up

headline: A good company to work for those who wish to grow, learn and advance their careers.
pros: They are embracing innovation and a fresh approach in all areas of the company.
cons: None that I can think of.  I've been there 15+ years so that should say that I liked working there!

headline: Good
pros: Decent pay at job level.
cons: Job advancement hard to predict

headline: Sinking
pros: money is great but quotas are readjusted continually to prevent large bonus payouts. Benfits are great and generous. freedom to come and go with sales calls
cons: instability of the industry as a whole. instability within the company itself. mystery quota adjustments at midterm. mystery sales credit determinations. team selling sucks

headline: Great benefits but...
pros: great benefits, culture, pretty clean, great open doors communication to all coworkers and managers
cons: poor family-work balance, the shifts could be better scheduled, no personal and professional growth, you must be a friend of a manager  to obtain a promotion.

headline: Take the good with the bad
pros: Comp is good, people are smart and what the company does is about as important as it gets. Wall Street loves the management. The current CEO is light years beyond his predecessors.
cons: Management loves Wall Street and their 1-3 year myopia may burn them down the road. Lots of middle and non-executive-managers managing up which means upper management becomes extremely out of touch with front-line reality.

headline: All Business
pros: Progressive, risk tolerant, always changing/learning
cons: Stressful, always acquiring and cutting, more focused on cutting costs and people than growing the top line, preaching engagement and balance but not practicing it

headline: Project Manager IV
pros: Promote Work/ Life Balance. Fast paced work environment. Very smart people to work with. Constant changes create steady opportunities for growth. World class product pipeline.
cons: Career ladders are rigid. Top down cascade creates lack of buy-in from shop floor environment. Change is not embrassed well and line of communication across departments is horrible. Political atmosphere worst than a GOP convention.

headline: Good place to work, great people
pros: Pay, benefits, opportunity to grow.
cons: Shift changes with little notice

headline: An interesting place to work.
pros: Good team effort, opportunity to learn, people care.
cons: Layoffs always hanging over your head.

headline: Good Place to Start A Career, Not a Place for Long-term Expectations
pros:
It is a paycheck
Good institution to learn cannibalistic methods in management
Good institution to learn what not to do in one's career
Nice location
cons:
Many middle managers lack insight to the future, they are just surviving week to week
Many supervisors lack adequate supervisory skills.
Many middle managers have no empathy, except for their own survival

headline: An average huge company that use to be great
pros: Reasonable company to work for with Industry average salaries and other incentives.  Corporate culture established over a long time. Reasonable benefits although they have been decreasing over time.
cons: The company is very big and not well integrated.  Very difficult to get things done across functional areas.  Communication from senior leaders is not robust.  The company has been financially focused over the past ten years with few new products.  Cost cutting is a major focus.

headline: Had some great years at Pfizer.
pros: This is a place of business where you I made many lifetime friends.   The compensation and benefits are above average.  Gym and backup daycare onsite.
cons: Work life balance is fair but can be challenging at times because of all of the restructuring. No new products and patents expiring is concerning.

headline: Competent people in a challenging environment, young staff lack in-depth experience for roles they have
pros: Solid company, good benefits, pay.  Management reflects the high value the culture places on developing people.
cons: With some younger managers, good people often not recognized.  A lot of young people trying to act like "grownups".   Research direction can be ambiguous for scientific/technical research group--reflects the environment they operate in.

headline: Good company to work for but the level of job uncertainty is way too high!
pros: Best training in the industry and quality products.   Salary and benefits are excellent and most of managers strive to help their representatives become better sales people. Territories are manageable.
cons: Company has layoffs or restructuring  almost every two years. Stress level is high due to  constant concerns about job security. Sales data is usually delayed and bonus payout dates are frequently changed. Many career opportunities exist ,but you must be willing to relocate your whole family and hope that you do not get laid off within two years.

headline: Analyst
pros: Great working environment to be in
cons: Nothing much just normal multinational issues

headline: Cut Throat Environment
pros: Exceptional Pay with Great Benefits
cons: Abrasive Environment, Rude and Pathetic

headline: Great chemistry, terrible management.
pros: Good scientists scattered throughout organization.
cons: Management structure without scientific expertise.

headline: Innovative but employment practices are questionable
pros: Benefits, salary and work life balance
cons: Growth and development of current colleagues

headline: Overall, it's been a good ride...
pros: Pay and benefits are all you could ask for, and the company does a lot for the local and global communities.Most of all, I really appreciate my amazing co-workers, who care about what they do and are committed to delivering new medicines to patients.  The company does a great job of keeping people focused on what's important and tries to make it easier to get your work done.
cons: Having said that, it's a really big company, so it CAN be hard to get things done sometimes.  It's also been difficult to see so many of my coworkers lose their jobs.  Job security hasn't been great in recent years.

headline: Tough Company to Work For
pros: Many expert professionals dedicated to good outcomes.  Great compensation and benefits.
cons: Top-down management style.  Rhetoric of core values with focus on employees doesn't match actions.  Creative thought and action is stifled as middle management tends to be risk-averse for fear of stepping on leadership's toes when it comes to initiatives, strategic decision-making, etc.  An intimidating culture...fun and greater purpose has been removed.

headline: good experience
pros: good territories, good balance of home and work
cons: There really is not anything I can think of

headline: Learning Experience
pros:
Colleagues are helpful. A lot of talented people to work with. 
Good salary.
cons:
Poor hiring of new manager from a non-pharma background. She doesn't know Pfizer's culture and was not willing to learn. Keeps harping on mistakes instead of giving advise and moving forward. Never listens to you, refuse to communicate as a team and never respect you as a team player. Also a racist! 
Communication barriers as English was so atrocious!
Too much of things are being dumped to you be it in your job scope or not. 
Management not understanding of your workload.

headline: Robotic
pros: Worked as a sales rep, pretty standard experience. Had good perks back in day, loved working out of the office and in a territory.
cons: Too many reorganizations. Unfortunate symptom of being a large corporation is that people truly are a number and a commodity.

headline: Overall good company with good people.
pros: Good salary and advancement opportunities.
cons: Healthcare market changing, companies and sales reps will need to adjust to succeed.

headline: Overall great learning experience
pros: Large company with global resources.  Compared to the other pharma MNCs, there are enough set processes and discipline that the management is decent.  I saw it grow from a $500M USD business to $1.7B USD business in 4 years so it was a nice front row seat to all of the changes
cons:
No surprises considering that it is a large multinational: 1) lots of politics; 2) silos; 2) too many people need to be CCed or involved but not enough decision making

Turnover was extremely high.  It was to the point that every 4 years or so would be a new organization.

headline: Potential to be a great company
pros: extensive pipeline; world leader in R&D; competitive benefits/salaries
cons: unstable environment with ongoing reorganizations and threat of layoff; limited career paths

headline: Great company to work
pros: Benefits, growth, leadership, vision, strong financial
cons: Too big an organization, too many regulations etc..

headline: Pretty satisfied. The usual big company bureaucratic problems.
pros: Compensation, great people, interesting work
cons: Hard to get things done and hard to think about how to improve this

headline: Interviewed for the position I held as a contractor for more than a year
pros: Encouraged me right up until the end! - took advantage of all of my ideas for improvement and really improved the program...
cons: Told me that they preferred to hire within - when asked for them to confirm that 1. I didn't have the most experience or 2. I didn't have the best ideas for program improvement or 3. I wasn't the best fit for the program and job description - I was told - "No, I didn't say any of that. What I am saying is this is the best for Pfizer, Inc. People are losing their jobs - we need to put them somewhere." - I then went on to set up a new infrastructure and train all of the "new hires" - people they needed to put somewhere so that they didn't have to report them as turnover...

headline: A terrific journey for 16 years
author_position: Various Marketing and Market Research Roles
pros: Bright accomplished colleagues, significant responsibilities, opportunities for movement into a variety of different functions, geographies, strong spirit of teamwork
cons: Very intense assignments can lead to lack of work life balance. Process-heavy, In the last 8-10 continuous reorganizations make employees feel insecure about their jobs

headline: Pfizer Review
pros: Worked for this company for 10 years and never once hated getting up to go to work!
cons: you can get very complacent and comfortable.

headline: There were ups and downs, ,but for the most part an overall good experience
pros: Great Pay, Benifits, Close to home
cons: At times unappreciated, longer hrs

headline: There were ups and downs, ,but for the most part an overall good experience

headline: Rewarding yet unsatisfying in many ways
pros: Compensation above average and the benefits are great.
cons: Lack of promotions and career ladders for all colleagues.  Lack of recognition for going above and beyond. Shows biases against employees.  Communication amongst different depts. is very poor.

headline: De-emphasized research and outsources as much as possible
pros: Benefits and salary, nice facilities, state of the art technology
cons: Just about everything else. There's a lot of back-stabbing and empire-building going on, and everyone's looking for the next group to cut.

headline: Great company - proud to say I was a Pfizer employee
pros: There are some really talented people who work at Pfizer - it's nice to work with smart and organized people. The company also has great benefits and compensates you well.
cons: It's often the tale of two cities - depending on what area you are working in, it can feel like a completely different company.

headline: Big company
pros: Decent pay and benefits. Everything you would expect from a big company.
cons: Industry experiencing cutbacks so morale was low.

headline: Good
pros: Overall a good company to work with good career prospect and on the job training.
cons: $$$ is not so fantastic at my site.

headline: Company treated me very well overall - benefits, pay, etc.
pros: Completely surrounded by tremendous talent! A feeling of doing something good for people!
cons: WAY TOO CENTRALIZED in their leadership and running the company. Also, Board is too lazy, or too cozy, to take action and get rid of total screwups at the Executive through "C" level positions. Why waste the time and money on a board if their experience, decisiveness and leadership insights are not going to be utilized to protect the shareholders. Case in point - length of time 2 successive previous CEO's to Ian Read were allowed to run company into the ground and the value lost. Shameless!!!

headline: While in transition -- integrating new companies into the Pfizer family
pros: Pfizer tried to be as transparent as possible throughout the process.  The importance of an acquisition was clearly communicated.
cons: Pfizer is such a large organization, it has many rumors and selections/promotions of candidates seems to be via favoritism vs. rigid process.

headline: Great company with great benefits
pros: The company has great benefits compared to other fortune 100 companies.
cons: It is very hard to get promoted to next level up or in different function of the company.

headline: Good pay, smart people, challenging opportunities
pros: Change is part of the Pfizer culture and it requires you to constantly meet new people and learn new skills
cons: The only downside is the red tape. It is difficult to get things done and promotions and job placements are not transparent.

headline: Sales executive
pros: Good environment, good pay, good training ground

headline: Great fringe benefits

- engagement activities

headline: Spoiled but grateful for all the challenging opportunities

headline: Very Very Bad cultured company with fake ego of being no.1 in Industry, no regards for people
pros: Nothing to say, they are hiring people in less package to undeserving people, who made this comapany culture and repo so worst, now they recruit unqualified people who even does kow to speak english and medical terminology,
cons: Even I worked under that kind of NSM who does know to speak english, over all this company is bad for your mental and proffessional health.

headline: Company
pros: Great company to work for.

headline: Great experience, new management needed...
pros: I loved the training they provided. I learned a lot of new things that has helped me in my current field. I was able to learn all of the aspects by great peer mentoring and being able to create my own brand within the company.
cons: I did not feel that management was on my side. The managers would not listen to their teams and refused to handle conflict within the team. It was constantly swept under the rug, which caused a revolving door.

headline: I work in Pfizer because it buys Wyeth.

headline: Team oriented and a family atmosphere

headline: Average

headline: Great place to work
pros: Good products. People development. Growing by challenge.
cons: Future pipeline. Cost pressure. Unstable due to integration.

headline: Pfizer provides excellent sales training that is viewed highly by other corporations.
pros: Flexible work schedule (Field Sales), Awesome benefits (medical, 401K, etc), Excellent training (very good at preparing reps for their day-to-day activities)
cons: Difficult to make cross-functional moves (Sales to Corporate), While Pfizer is good at training people for their current role, not so great at developing talent beyond current role.

headline: Pfizer India Current Scenerio
pros:
It "USED" be .... And... Yes i Mean It "USED" to be a great company in terms of behavioral, Cultural, and Ethical standards. I love this company even today because This company always taught me a lot and developed me as a Good Professional and Sure to mention.. developed me as a  person of ethics....They used to mean what they said, They used to do what they preach and lots of Respect for people and transparency was in the Air which is now On Papers..Today no body listens to others there are lots of piece of workshops, preaching and advises for UPLIFT and they are mere words on wall.
 So the Pros and Cons can be read in the same box here.
cons: You can be thrown out anytime if your face is not liked by your Boss, If you try to inculcate work ethics and drive process and systems and your superiors only expect you to treat your people as pawns and reap business at any cost...no matter people learn or not, they are helped in becoming a good professional or not or they do it with ethics or not.... though all these things are there in the Books but avoided within the board room discussions and if you try to implement the good learning, you are a culprit, because there are some other culprits around who are not able to compete on ethics, and process's and hence form a group to eliminate you. The Great Pfizer is Dying a slow death.

headline: Good company to start a career in biotech
pros: Good people to work with.

headline: Great Science, but needs work on culture and compensation.
pros: Great science and research opportunities.
cons: Compensation not competitive with local area biotechs. Need to have more cultural and life balance activities and investment. Need more investment to compete with local area companies as best place to work in Boston.

headline: Great company with lots of learning opportunities.
pros: Great company history, has a lot of different products ranging from various pharmaceutical categories to over the counter products. Also they do have some beautiful campuses.
cons: As such a large company it can sometimes move a bit slower than some would like. The integration with Wyeth a couple years ago also took substantial time and was worrisome for many people.

headline: 3 out of 5 stars
pros: Good people, facility, leadership team
cons: can't get things done, very layered, analysis paralysis

headline: Love working here
pros: wonderful co-workers, supportive, friendly, understanding, great work life balance, great benefits, great salary,
cons:
Too big, can be difficult to get the job done
Operating model changes continually
Shortsighted, restructures lost many very talented staff. Lots of regret when restructure failed
Long commute

headline: insecurity for job IN FIELD FORCE

pros: employee friendly FOR FIELD FORCE

headline: Miss this place
pros: Although I was laid off due to the acquisition, I wouldn't hesitate to return. Great people, great environment, nice perks getting discounted products.
cons: I have none at this time.

headline: Overall  employment experince was good.
pros: Sales Compensation package is good.
cons: To many young inexperienced district managers.

headline: Sales professionals are the norm not the exception
pros: Salary and benefits are top notch, integrity of managers is generally strong, respect for people (employees) isn't just lip service.
cons: At times company is too big, easy to get lost in the machine

headline: Loved working at Pfizer!
pros: Great place to work, no micro management
cons: Did not like the instability - Company layoffss

headline: Good career growth opportunity, difficult to get things done.
pros: Pfizer provided excellent opportunities for personal and professional development.  The top level, dedicated talent at all levels of the organization are fun to work with.
cons: It can be very difficult to get things done due to the volumes of red tape.  The company has a laser-like focus on the deliver of short term goals, which makes it challenging for those with an eye towards more longer term achievement.

headline: Best job I've had so far!
pros:
No micro-managing
Good salary
Room for advancement
cons: It was a contract position which meant I could not go to most of the team meetings or the Christmas party. Contract employees should be treated the same as regular employees. Sometimes it made me uncomfortable, like an outcast, but I dealt with it. I would probably still be working there if I had not moved out of state.

headline: Great experience
pros: Training and Development, competitive, diverse
cons: Some managers lack competence and not much room for growth

headline: Working for Pfizer has been a positive experience
pros: The benefits at Pfizer are competitive. Management constantly looks for feedback to make improvements.
cons: As a large company, Pfizer can often have a 'corporate' feeling. Simple things can be difficult to get done because of inefficient processes.

headline: Senior Healthcare Representative
pros: Loved my customers & colleagues at Pfizer; exceptional training; very high standards of excellence required of their employees, which I greatly appreciated.
cons: The relentless threat of layoffs for everyone within the company, no matter how excellent one's track record of performance.

headline: My experience working for Pfizer was 'ok'.
pros: Flexibility to work from home when necessary.
cons:
Management seems to care more about meeting numbers than they are of patients. 
No value for employees in other locations other than CT.

headline: Good company
pros: great pay great benefits challenging problems  to work on
cons: Science some times comes in second fiddle

headline: Politics, bureaucracy, business model impacts on research
pros: Some of the pros of this company are good benefits, good people, interesting projects, and good work/life balance
cons: Some of the cons are poor leadership, constantly changing models, parts of the organization working in silos. For a big company cross-functional mobility is challenging

headline: Overall I obtained great experience during my tenure and I met some really good people.
pros: Work life balance and capability of working from home.  Salary and benefits are great compared to the market place.  Some of my best friends are coworkers I met through my years at Pfizer. Good people!
cons: Lots of uncertainty because of excessive lay offs causing work load to increase but it is still manageable.

headline: Great benefits and salary. Little upward mobility.
pros: Salary, work/ life balance, benefits
cons: A declining industry, not much room for promotion

headline: My time at Pfizer has been increasingly more demanding and fulfilling.
pros: Pfizer has a very good pay scale , has opportunities to succeed and excel if you want them.
cons: Increased outsourcing has required each employee to take on massive workloads.

headline: A great experience.
pros: Large multinational multicultural environment, good company culture,
cons: The fate of most large companies; Restructures, mergers, etc.

headline: Difficult days
pros: Benefits, evolution, people, enterprise support
cons: Life work balance, uncertainty, politics

headline: "Pfizer is a Good Company to Work For."
pros: Compensation and benefits are better than most companies. There is opportunity for advancement wihin the company with the right skillset. Employees are more than willing to meet demanding deadlines to make sure the customers needs are met.
cons: With the many layers of management decision making can be slow to get things done. Outsourcing too many jobs to contractors can hurt the company.

headline: Excellent
pros:
R&D is well funded and the latest technology is available
Work with world class scientists and commercial expertise
cons: Decision making takes too long, the Company is not a nimble organization

headline: Overly bureaucratic.  Some good people.
pros: At one time was willing to invest in training.  "Leader behaviors" developed in the 2000's was good.
cons: Too much micromanagement and bureaucracy.  Challenging financials with products coming off patent and a dwindling pipeline.

headline: Sr. Director
pros: good purpose, good pay, impactful position
cons: collaborative, slower than possible ,political

headline: Great company
pros: Great people work at this company
cons: Constant restructuring and constant layoffs

headline: More good than bad
pros: Good pay and benefits; good people to work with
cons: Overly bureaucratic; Poor work-life balance; Very little creativity

headline: Pfizer is a great company to work for with a promising future.
pros: Pfizer has competitive salaries and bonuses, and if you do well, you will be rewarded well.
cons: It's a shame that merit and track record aren't the only tools used for promotions.  Like many other companies, it's who knows you.

headline: Pays great wages, but is it really worth it? Management spends too much effort saving dimes by stepping over dollars.
pros: The wages they pay are pretty darn good, but that's how they keep people. You can't find these wages anywhere else, especially for those with no degree.
cons: Management promotes people who pay them lip service, not those who really put forth the effort. They continually cut people, then pile their work into the desks of those left behind. So, then- the wage/workload balance tips very unfavorably, You swim in a sea of impossible task lists, all the while really dreading coming in the next day and having to do it all over again.

headline: Great company, Excellent work environment
pros: Great people, great pay and benefits, fast pace, exciting work
cons: Ongoing changes (which are well communicated and planned)

headline: Pfizer is a good place to work
pros: Good Salary and Benefits package. Good Business Culture. Opportunities for advancement
cons: Unrealistic Work Load sometimes that stretches people too thin. Financial Management software sub-par.

headline: Very focused on the bottom line
pros: Good career opportunities f you are willing to travel and play the corporate game
cons: The bottom line drove all activities, respect for people was somewhat lacking

headline: Standard corporate environment, with the benefit of having a population of talented/specialized colleagues.
pros: Good colleagues/experts in their field, huge knowledge-base. Most colleagues are appreciative, respectful, and recognize the contributions of their administrative assistants. Diversity is supported (there are formal diversity networks/groups internally), active in local community, beautiful site in San Diego (La Jolla Campus) with excellent on-site cafe and catering.
cons: Organizational changes happen frequently. Annual review process is not well managed and suffers from imbalance. Glass ceiling: incredibly difficult/rare to move from administrative support position into another role/position/career (even with an MBA). Management effectiveness/style varies by department (true anywhere); be sure to make inquiries, if interviewing (Pharma  community is small, easy to gain honest insight--be sure work style is complimentary).

headline: Good company
pros: Large organization where you can learn a lot
cons: Lots of bureaucracy! Forever restructuring, no security

headline: Not for me
pros: The pay and benefits were fair.
cons: Employees are just a number.  The company is just after the bottom line and don't care if they screw people over.

headline: Good and Bad
pros: Great Brand, Good learning. It also has a good training program and has some strog legacy brands
cons: Poor Pay. Turbulence in management policies is also causing some amount of problems for the compay

headline: The Pfizer Workplace
pros: Multi billion in revenues. Encourages people to move from area to area to share experience. Trying to push an innovative culture.
cons: Pfizer is a shrinking company in a heavily regulated industry with it's eye firmly fixed on shareholder value. Complex internal HR structure and processes.

headline: good company to join & learn
pros: good benefit & environment to work
cons: none at this moment of time

headline: Management
pros:
Good in terms of benefit, salaries.
Among peers there is a good inter relationship.
cons:
Lack of planning.
Changes is very common but sometimes, it happens without long term view.
Politic surpass competence.
Lack of Work/ Life balance.

headline: Was there for approximately 9 years
pros: Site was providing valuable contribution to Prevnar vaccine
cons: Too much politics and butting into other peoples jobs.

headline: Never Regret for working at Pfizer
pros:
1. International operation leads to job opportunities
2. Good benefit package
cons: disturbing reorganizations; Limited opportunities for career development in R&D organization;

headline: A wonderful company to work for years ago when there were company outing and bonuses
pros: Family oriented, great benefits, work life balance
cons: No growth or bonuses for support staff.

headline: The business is mainly in Sales & Marketing
pros: The company had a strong teamwork culture. There used to be a weekly company-wide meeting/assembly for announcement. Employees are encouraged to speak and present during these meetings. Management encourages employee to develop and learn, eg. providing incentives for employees to read.
cons: Like other pharma companies, Pfizer is focusing on major markets like China, leaving the Hong Kong office to be the execution hub mainly in sales and marketing. HQ is cutting budget for most of the initiatives in HK.

headline: Good Place to Intern
pros:
-Relaxed work environment
-Interesting research projects
-Great mentors and advisors
cons:
-State of the pharmaceutical industry
-Lack of employee motivation (the constant layoffs have led to some serious morale issues)

headline: Production Pharmacist at Cairo plant
pros: Strong Quality Systems, excellent training programs, high flexibility, generous in business needs, very strong reputation among regulators and competitors
cons: Old management, brutal management style, power culture, low pay

headline: Enormous company, rife with politics, great benefits.
pros:
Pretty competitive base salary levels
Excellent benefits and policies
Work from home arrangements available at least once per week, if not more, in most groups
Excellent name/brand recognition
cons:
Extremely political culture
Hard to tell where you really stand and if you're "in"
Only those who are in the know get promoted - not transparent process
Constant fear of the next round of layoffs creates a toxic environment full of finger pointing and self-serving behaviors. 
Culture is not team-oriented
Bonus program doesn't go very far down in the organization

headline: ba
pros: in this company for a while
cons: ok but can be better

headline: Great Experience. Poor career development. Widespread cost-cutting makes job bad.
pros: Great colleagues who are fun to work with and make day to day business fun. Managers are hit and miss. Some are fantastic and are enjoyable to work for, others are the complete opposite.
cons:
Managers are all talk and no action. There is a lot of talk and online development for your career however at the end of the day, career progression is at the discretion of your manager, who may veto any development or promotion based on what is best for them. 

Another issue is staff satisfaction. With recent changes to the business including widespread cost cutting measures, staff are very dissatisfied with Pfizer and how difficult and unenjoyable the job has become.

headline: Great people on a global scale
pros: The people are the reason I enjoy my job; the benefits and compensation are on par with other pharmas
cons: Too many projects and not much alignment among enabling functions to mitigate the workload requirements; very political

headline: Great Job,but...
pros: Excellent Pay, Benefits and coworkers
cons: The saying in Pfizer is that the only thing constant is change, and it is true. There is always a fear of losing your job because of those changes.

headline: Director BT
pros: Great benefits and culture, good company, good people, fair
cons: Talent not recognized. Lot of politics, some poor skilled senior BT execs who won't let talent rise

headline: Generally a very good company to work for
pros: Large company with excellent benefits, treated employees very well.
cons: Constantly downsizing, with little to no plan for future success.

headline: Pfizer sales rep
pros: Largest pharma company in the world and brings the best products to market.  Great benefits and good salary.  Best local team I have ever worked with and the best DM.
cons: Pfizer does not do the background/behind the scenes work to help the reps.  Most products are not on the formularies and that makes a hard sell in the field.

headline: Good but volatile
pros: Salary, benefits, working with talented people.
cons: Constant change and turnover; not for the faint of heart

headline: Pfizer, KOL Management
pros: Great training and learned a lot about pharma. Very professional work environment. Clearly identified career path. Had the chance to work with very smart people.
cons: Employees can be really competitive. Networking is extremely important to be able climb up the career ladders. Extremely performance oriented company.

headline: Top-notch company
pros: Excellent benefits and hours. Managers were approachable and positive. Very agreeable to health sabbatical (surgery).
cons: I had to cancel a vacation because of last minute schedule changes.

headline: It's industry
pros: Great facility with all the fancy bells and whistles. The benefits and compensation are great, won't get anywhere near it in academe.
cons: It's very corporate. In my 1 year there, there were 3 massive lay-offs as projects just got dumped; even scientists who were very accomplished and had been there for 10 years lost their jobs. It didn't affect me, but other post-docs lost their mentors and project, and kind of got lost in the shuffle.

headline: Avoid Pfizer IT at All Costs
pros: Cannot think of one good thing to say about Pfizer IT.  Seriously.
cons: It's considered cool to yell at people in meetings.  Layoffs occur every two weeks like clockwork.

headline: Great company with strong brand names
pros:
Great training program and you learn a lot about the disease states and your products. 
Well known company and products that can usually get you into offices.
Great people and amazing benefits!
cons: Lack of job stability with the constant restructuring and downsizing due to drugs losing exclusivity and various other factors.

headline: Pfizer Kalamazoo - what a ride!!!!
pros: These have been absolutely the best people with whom I have ever worked!!!! There is no challenge too large or unique that they will not take on and just completely "crush it!" - Overachieve
cons: Leadership - senior level for site andtheir superiors, are out of touch with the shop floor workers and too wrapped up in their egos! No decisions can be decentralized - everything is very much dictated and micro-managed in spite of the massive amounts of talent and creativity at the Site!

headline: Being exposed to the Pharma Industry
pros: Pfizer will make you work like crazy, yet the work being done gives you a multifaceted exposure to various depts in the organization. They will trust you with your work and make sure you deliver. They treat you with respect, and have a nice office culture.
cons: They have a huge gap in levels of management. There either are grass root level employees or vetaran directors, and no middle management to fill in the stairs.

headline: Once wonderful, now depressing and negative
pros: Only big pharma in NYC, convenient location in midtown Manhattan, intelligent colleagues, potential for opportunities across company (assuming you last through all of the cuts / layoffs), excellent healthcare benefits
cons: Negative culture, lack of camaraderie, nonstop cuts to benefits and infinite layoffs, management's inability to stop repeating the same bad decisions, eventual move from NYC to Collegeville, big brother-like environment

headline: pfizer
pros: good pay, benefits, and it is very rewarding knowing you are working on drugs to affect peoples life
cons: management is awful, completely out of touch with anything going on. Morale is horrible. It is a complete mess

headline: Confusing and political machinations affect productivity.
pros: Location in new York city.  Entrepreneurialism encouraged.
cons: Constant reorganizations.  Confusing organizational structure dictated by politics.

headline: Some of the smartest business people you'll ever work with; very political environment
pros: Pfizer is full of talent and capability.  People who work their are truly passionate about the pharma/healthcare industry and the good that it does.  The company is very Wall Street-savvy and manages to please investors, which is not a bad thing.  If you are smart and network with the right decision-makers, you can write your own ticket to a robust career.  Pfizer donates to so many good causes and sends its talented personnel all over the world to work pro-bono on establishing health care infrastructure in countries where little infrastructure exists.
cons: The company can be cheap to a default.  Asking employees to fund their own relocation and international assignments is not a market-competitive practice.  The New York HQ office environment can be so political that the buzz distracts employees from doing their work.  There is founded and constant worry about layoffs, which happens each year at least in the hundreds.

headline: If you are a male HR professional could not be the best company for a career
pros:
Life-Work balance
Very Good Salary
Many opportunities to develop a careers BUT ONLY if you are part of the main business.
cons:
In small countries or region you can be in the same positions for years and years...
If you are friend of the Hiring Manager then exists a strong opportunity to grow up, but not necesarily because your work is good.
Most of the People in HR is not good at all.
HR prefers a lot female than males.

headline: 8 years of greatness, 2 years of missery
pros: Values Culture, very skilled Employees, Interesting and challenging work experience due to Multiple Operations (not boring at all), good salaries and benefits.
cons: After the latest adquisition, an excellent place to work became a nightmare.  There is no balance between work and life, not enough employees to preform the tasks necessary, moving to sub-contract most positions leading to lack of expertisse by Pfizer Employees, lack of respect to Employees due to aggressive non-inclusive management,  had become a battlefield between Pfizer Legacy Management and former Wyeth Management,  No-career growth path.

headline: Good science while it lasted
pros: Motivated scientists who enjoy their work
cons: Constant R&D re-organizations mean ever changing roles and lay-offs

headline: The Wasteland
pros:
Pay is decent
Advanced, life-saving or life-enhancing technology
cons: Some great colleagues buried under an awful pseudo-culture, made up of knit-together acquisitions.

headline: Pfizer
pros: Environment, benefits in kind, health insurance.
cons: Stress, timelines, poor development, only promises

headline: The roller coaster ride of my life!!
pros: Best pipeline training in the Industry.  Top in Incentive and Compensation.
cons: Loss of patent protection.  Robust generic pipeline.  Over regulatory environment.  All these factors have led to a company wrought with creative paralysis.  Recent quarterly earnings reports have been sugar coated to cover up fact that sales force, scientists, and corporate staffs are being laid off at an alarming rate.  Retained employees are seeing their severance packages curtailed and pensions are going away.  Compliance regulations have ensured total sales force paralysis.  When you are afraid to communicate about your products on your corporate laptops, then there is something wrong with the corporate enviornment!!

headline: Great place to work if you overlook the politics.
pros: Good people. They truly want to make a difference.  Great experience. The company (at least many divisions) is flexible with working from home and/or other offices as needed.
cons: Very political and bureaucratic - continuous downsizing has caused the culture to become more cut throat instead of collaborative.

headline: Could and should have been better
pros:
Strong benefits
Everyone knows Pfizer
Reasonable workload
Nice travel and perks
cons:
Career potential lost in constant survival mode in downsizing company.
Most of network over the years I was there had been laid off or left for other opportunity
No external training or conference funds in my dept
poor internal job placement and recruiting processes, seems like candidates are pre-selected and you waste time going through meaningless interviews if your even selected at all.

headline: Great Company
pros: Fair compensation for their employees
cons: Lay offs common in the past few years

headline: It was not an enriching career experience
pros: The work life balance was good, benefits was not too bad.
cons: The whole career expereince was tarnish by an incompetent supervisor and company culture. There was no team work in the department.

headline: Regional Corporate Finance
pros: Flex time, good salaries, careers, people management
cons:
BT systems
Old Managers
Focus not oriented sometimes

headline: nerves were tested every quarter wondering when layoffs were coming
pros: Some team members were great to work with
cons: Downsize is coming always you never know when

headline: Max workload, little reward or recognition.
pros: Excellent benefits and a very good clinic on site that will see you even for non-work related illnesses.
cons: Work your fingers to the bone and get little recognition. Bonuses were often 1 percent,maybe 1 and a half. Promotions seemed to go to boot lickers, or those favored because they socialized with management at the bar or out on the golf course after work.

headline: Good Salary And Benfits, golden handcuffs not wortth it
pros: Some very talented people. Very good salary and benfits. Wealth of informational resources.
cons: Some vey talented people work here who are very dedicated, but too afraid of job protection to really take thoughtful risk and push business forward. Culture sucks-Still good ole boys mentality.

headline: Annual Review
pros: Discussed strengths of skills in meeting goals
cons: You are nameless and faceless

headline: District business manager
pros: Good benefits and resources. Great employees. Truly trying to match healthcare and community needs with our products to create value fr our customers and patients
cons: Non stable work environment with consistent layoffs

headline: Big, slow moving but in turn around mode
pros: Generally good resources available; Pockets of the company are eager to move forward with urgency to discover and develop pharmaceuticals
cons: Consensus decision making culture which slows things down; watch your back; Risk tolerance can be unreasonably low; Quality of science is spotty

headline: Excellent people, difficult business environment
pros: Pfizer has some of the most talented professionals I've ever worked with.  The scale of the organization allows for incredible growth opportunities and experiences.
cons: The company is experiencing declining revenues due to loss of exclusivity on products.  This means major cost cutting.  There are opportunities; however, it can be draining work.

headline: Good company going through rough times
pros:
Outstanding colleagues
Global opportunities
Diverse commercial experiences
Strong executive management
cons:
Downsizing pains - "do more with less"...but they are used to more with more
Opportunities to move roles are dramatically less (again, downsizing)
Transparency is an issue (HR policies, salary equity, development opportunities and internal talent management)

headline: Professional Healthcare Rep.
pros: Long history, reputation for blockbuster drugs. Managed care coverage. Very extensive training
cons: 'boys club' - rarely promotes women. Need to relocate in order to advance. Micro-managing, DM's think they need to  dictate and not be a team player.

headline: Getting too big for their britches?
pros: Decent culture, decent pay.  Interesting work.  Interesting research!
cons: Mediocre management, cutthroat policies, arrogant atmosphere

headline: Great career while it lasts
pros: Great compensation and benefits for employees
cons: Lack of job stability for the past 5 years

headline: I was let go after one year due to a huge reorganization.
pros: Pfizer is a leading research pharmaceutical company.
cons: On Boarding was very stressfull and it lacked organization.

headline: Great pay and benefits but management is nepotistic.  Image is more important than qualifications.
pros: Excellent pay and benefits. Good work life balance.
cons: You better be in good with management if you want to be promoted or move around. Integrity and respect have been lost among the management.  The promotion  requirements are obscure.  The company is too large.

headline: Good Company
pros: Great opportunities to learn and develop, I felt that my work was recognised and was rewarded for hard work locally.
cons: Slow decision making by senior management.  Felt like there was a disconnect between US sites and rest of the world.

headline: good company but no so descent
pros: high salary and good condition
cons: no position  and always lay off people

headline: Ok place to work
pros: Talented and committed professionals dedicated to creating a quality product, overall good benefits, very good with community involvement and charitable causes,
cons: Did not like the appraisal system, lack of resources in some departments makes it harder to get things done, 401k matching was reduced, lay-offs due to restructuring

headline: Great Company, but Not Employee focused.
pros: Good solid company.  Nice facilities.
cons: They don't care much about contractors.  Once they know the a project is ending, you will get the axe quick.  And they don't do much to find you another project.

headline: Great Company, but Not Employee focused.
pros: Good solid company.  Nice facilities.
cons: They don't care much about contractors.  Once they know the a project is ending, you will get the axe quick.  And they don't do much to find you another project.

headline: envronment
pros: good place to work, and nice people
cons: very fast pace, and no training

headline: Good company
pros:
Good pay and facilities
Oppertunities to learn
cons:
lot of internal politics 
Slow processes

headline: Excellent Manager, negligent upper management
pros: Well paid, freedom, accountability, professionalism, local manager
cons: Micro-management, cronyism, Ill conceived quotas, poor data management, horrible report delivery time tables

headline: Tough environment currently
pros: Great experience in the past.  Good salaries and benefits.  Plenty of ability to learn. Ask and you shall receive as long as it is not upwards.
cons: too much change is choking everyone.  Bureaucracy is killing innovation.  its easier to get $1m for a project than it is to get $1k.  Still are not used to real world budgets and still think bigger is better.

headline: Good company to work for
pros: solid company, great support with metrics and promotional materials, good managers and people
cons: layoffs happen just about every year, ways of ranking/rating employees change continuously so its hard to keep up with what you are being measured against

headline: Great learning experience in a technology driven environment
pros: Great benefits, above normal salary for the area
cons: Lack of assistance in learning a new task

headline: Overall, a good place to work that is always changing and challenging.
pros: The opportunity for advancement and educational reimbursement program create an atmosphere of ever improving oneself to offer each employee and the company a better future.
cons: The schedule was very difficult to sustain. At times we were required to work 19 days at a stretch without a day off. We would then be given one day off and return to work the following day. The opportunities for overtime pay were excellent but no time to enjoy life or family.

headline: Great to start...
pros:
Good District Level Mangers
Motivational Leaders
Great Benefits and compensation, bonuses are declining
Work/life ratio is fair
cons:
No resources to help customers
Constantly changing products, messaging
Bad decisions on how to grow sales with new products
No new products, patent cliff

headline: Great experience that helped my career
pros:
Gained International/national exposure
Worked with individuals at all different levels
Excellent compensation and benefits
Interaction with different departments
cons:
Extensive travel (in my position)
Long hours, often into weekends, particularly where international travel is required

headline: Hindsight is 20/20
pros: Company is a great place to work for.  Doesn't get much better.
cons: Way too many chiefs running it.

headline: My career at Pfizer has been rewarding, although we live in a world of shrinking resources.
pros: People, venue, culture, benefits, career paths, opportunities, inclusiveness, open door policy, minority hiring practices, flexibility, salary competitiveness, personal development opportunities.
cons: Fear implications of constant change (potential job loss, site closures, mergers, downsizing, belt tightening, doing more with less, disparity between executive salary % increases vs. rest of company employees, offshoring. etc, etc, etc).

headline: Professional healthcare representative
pros: Great pay, benefits and access to great training when the offer it
cons: Dispose of employees with no rhyme or reason. Reps are just a number and when they buy another company for their pipeline they get rid of all their employees to " right size "

headline: My Pfizer work experience
pros: Great benefits, pay well, promote work-life balance
cons: To many restructurings, too many changes

headline: Good company to work for
pros: Great company to work for
cons: Tough business environment, demanding expectations

headline: Challenging , fast paced with Perks
pros: There is a "can do attitude" , access to resources, generous compensation. Allows for individual to be a self starter, not a lot of  layers of management to get things done.
cons: Potential for "dog eat dog" working environment.  Internally competitive, as the company faces layoffs.  Work life-balance is a negative, long  grueling hours without break, due to tight timelines and heavy workload.

headline: IT - Pfizer - tough to get stuff done
pros: Great Benefits, and to access to training (both professional and non-professional) is good.
cons: The higher ups talk a good game.. the usual "my door is always open", "we promote a work-life balance". But rarely act on "suggestions". The survey's that mgmt asks for are a complete joke. The Executive Leadership team, wants to hear from the worker bee's to make it look as if they are involved, but honestly very little has been to done to make the job easier to handle. It is Mgmt 101, if mgmt gives you one, or two more projects that are high priority, then one or two items must be taken away from you in order to let you work on those high priority projects, in the 7 years I've been with them, that has never happened once. There is absolutely no communication between the various sections within IT. I do not know that a policy has changed until, it is too late.

headline: You will get the best training there.
pros: I would like to say the work atmosphere is really nice. You will face different tasks everyday and you do learn a lot from these missions.
cons: It depends on the whole pharma industry. Since some blockbusters have lost the patent, it is more challenge in competing with others and secure the lead position for Pfizer now.

headline: well cultured compay
pros: very good company where u have live a balance life between professional and personal
cons: in india  its not  making decision according to indian market

headline: Pfizer Biologics as a biotech Co.
pros: contemporary, resourced well, trying hard
cons: bureaucratic, hierarchical, formal, too big

headline: Vice President - Compliance
pros: Great industry and product line
cons: Poor record on culture and diversity

headline: Mgr
pros: lots of smart people in the organization
cons: business model evolving leads to lots of changes

headline: Quality people, products and processes
pros: Pfizer has been an excellent company to work for.  The organization has consistently lived up to their value of respect for people...providing competitive compensation and benefits, and assuring that when layoffs occur, that those who are severed, are prepared for the transition.  The quality of the work environment is often heavily influenced by direct leadership/management, and I have been very fortunate to work alongside some of the very best leaders I have come across.
cons: A lack of continuity/frequent adjustments with regards to territory boundaries and account responsibilities has effectively equated to hitting the reset button on performance in a number of geographies.  Pfizer is attempting to remain change agile, but in many situational examples, the sheer size of the organization often precludes local level input and influence on decisions that would further the greater enterprise.

headline: Great Experience while it last
pros: The Benefits/Compensation and co-workers are excellent
cons: Too many changes/always fearful of losing your job

headline: Patent Cliff Abyss
pros: I worked with incredibly talented people who were smart and cared about improving people's health.
cons: The leadership of the company is 100% solely beholden to the shareholder, no one else matters. Managers don't care about their employees because at any moment they could be asked to lay them off.  Top performers be damned.

headline: Competitive salaries, great benefits, murky future
pros: Opportunity to work with some really great people.  As a large company, many opportunities to develop oneself by applying for more challenging positions. Some teams are well aligned.
cons:
Steady stream of layoffs results in general unease - who will be next?  The pharmaceutical business model is changing dramatically due to lack of significant new products, regulatory pressure on sales, inability to influence managed healthcare decision makers, etc. The good old days of pharma are over.

Overly bureaucratic, and can be slow to make decisions

headline: Long term employee eventually laid off.
pros: Organized company.  Would work there again.
cons: Constant layoffs.  37 waves of layoffs in 2011 and continuing.  No job security.

headline: Good Company, good benefits
pros:
Opportunities to move around
Focus on personal development
Good benefit package
cons:
Location was not the best
Restructuring occured on a regular basis
Down sizing so became slightly more stressful place to be

headline: Could have been a lot better... time to refresh
pros: Big company with good benefits
cons: The company has declined and no longer is a good place to work. There are more layoffs than opportunities, promotions are unclear and often frozen.  Jobs internally are difficult to get and often determined in advance.  There is no serious development or growth at this company anymore and I have been here over ten years.

headline: Great career until layoffs began.........
pros: Great training, great products, great counterparts and managers, mostly.
cons: Some Management folks forgot what it was like to be a rep.

headline: Its a good place but with less regards for people
pros: A big MNC to learn business mangement through observation of some intelligent financial decisions made across various major accounting heads
cons: very system driven which delays decision making

headline: Great company to work for
pros: + well paid, many develpoment oppotunities but need more graduate opportunities especially for engineering graduates. Would recommend to anyone especially social sciences.
cons: - would like more opportunities in the UK, especially if the internships are not to run for as long any more unlike what they were before in 2009. The internshoip is highly recommend for anyone at all.

headline: It was a good learning experience and was happy to be associated with this great organization
pros: The company always encouraged best Innovation and Transparency. The upper management always there to listen and help their colleagues by providing conducive environment to give their best and enjoy the job fully.
cons: The career progress was limited. The RBM's have acted as impediments in the Business growth and also not caring their subordinates in terms of overall approach to the business. I would like the top management to evaluate the ground realities and be correct in deciding on the advise of the RBM's.

headline: The experience has been good.
pros: My experience has been good, I have developed in various areas and have been able to experience various facets of the business including finance, marketing, operations and managing.
cons: Due the changes that are occurring in the health care market, Pfizer has attempted to adapt the structure but there are going to be continuous changes in affecting the way business in done.

headline: Overall very good work experience
pros: good resources, well-paid, nice work environment, and integration of functions of different group. People were friendly and helpful and worked hard.
cons: unsure job with not so well set goals and execution. Creativity was not much encouraged. Too much time spent on administrative routines.

headline: in this organisation good product on basic cost good results of poduct
pros: here is the good manegement and oranisation  policy
cons: all thing is fine here.

headline: Pfizer was an amazing dream which became a dark nightmare.  One word - Lipitor!
pros:
Pfizer's compensation is remarkable.  
Scale is second to none.
Leading edge compared to other companies (pharma and non-pharma)
Amazing training and level of responsibility
cons:
Continuous Downsizing
Impression that Pfizer people do not do "hands-on" work by other companies
Spoiled due to outstanding salary and benefits
Available roles, outside the company, much narrower in scope, responsibility, compensation

headline: DSR
pros: Industry leader in all areas!
cons: Big companies do horribly in creating a personable environment and reacting to change or implementing great ideas on the fly!

headline: Long term, many good things -- recently --more bad things (downsizing)
pros: At one time was exciting, market leader with numerous opportunities and great people!
cons: Since the downsizings began, culture is not honest.

headline: Good solid company, don't rock the boat if you want to get ahead.
pros:
Good pay & benefits
Building a solid pipeline of products
Nice friendly working environment
Smart people who want to make a difference
cons: Political organization, need to know what people are saying about you behind your back.  If you disagree with direction or ideas you may be seen as a "problem" and not a team player unless you have a mgr who is willing to back you up.

headline: Review of Pfizer Pharmaceuticals
pros: Flexibility to work from home, so long as you're accessible via phone or web.
cons: Too many people pointing fingers and not taking responsibility.  Parties blamed are quick to be 'let go'. Lessons aren't learned, same mistakes are made by replacements and nothing gets accomplished.

headline: Good Company going through difficult times!
pros: Good benefit package, Comfortable work environment, able to set own hours.
cons: Many layoffs in works, company announcing they will continue for next several years.

headline: ok
pros: ok environment in a challenging industry
cons: stressful layoffs looming invokes constant worry for many

headline: Pfizer Saudi Arabia Review
pros:
Multinational Corporation
Leading & Mastering the Saudi Market
High Credibility within Healthcare Sector
Remarkable income compared to others
cons:
Very stressful atmosphere
Intra-personnel bad communications
Long path bureaucratic procedures of approvals
High egoistic tone dealing with others

headline: It is a roller coaster ride.
pros: Support communities, support staff involvement in supporting communites.
cons: Too big, too political, it did not mattered what your personal contribution was in the end when broad decisions were made to shutter an entire site.

headline: Tough industry to be in, but a great employer none the less
pros: Teamwork, values, culture, good work life balance
cons: Still not always easy to get work done, and sometimes senior management don't understand what's going on

headline: Great benefits for employees but difficult to avoid the constant threat of layoffs
pros: Good benefits.  Base salary and bonus above what most sales positions pay.   Good training.  Many managers are good and truly care about their people.
cons: Little job security, layoffs seem to happening every year.  The trend seems to be to replace Pfizer employees with contract reps for lesser salaries.

headline: Good Experience Global Processes
pros:
Excellent Redundancy Packages
Available resources
Intelligent Colleagues
cons: Career progression only for those who socialised with Director

headline: Great experience working for the biggest of the "Big Pharma" firms.
pros: Wonderful co-workers, terrific work environment, exciting projects with stimulating team members made working at Pfizer in Groton/New London and in NYC an absolute pleasure.  Good salary and benefits.
cons: Very little room for career development or advancement; constant acquisitions and reorganisations accompanied by large numbers of lay-offs lowered morale in recent years. Pfizer is now no longer the blue ribbon company it used to be and employees are starting to walk away.

headline: very good
pros: good working admonisher, support, growth opportunity
cons: nothing cons seen me, its good company

headline: very good
pros: good working admonisher, support, growth opportunity
cons: nothing cons seen me, its good company

headline: Manager at Pfizer (2 years)
pros: Good benefits. Opportunities to advance. Work from home model increasingly being accepted. Relatively flat organization. Reasonable compensation (not great, but not terrible either).
cons: Shrinking portfolio. Tough financial environment. Layoffs galore. Too many consultants so it's difficult to maintain continuity in projects.

headline: A comfortable place to work
pros: Lots of resource, comfortable and respectful workplace
cons: Frequent restructuring due to various changes in management and pending expiration of patented drugs.  Heavy politics in some dept.

headline: Pfizer, a hotbed for personal development
pros: Great people to work with having tremendous passion and desire to achieve success. In light of my recent layoff, Pfizer has provided me with many tools and experiences.
cons: From a corporate point of view, way too much focus on making money with the employee bearing the brunt of the sacrifice e.g. ongoing reductions, foreign manufacturing, outsourcing. Too much change and uncertainty. Unfortunatley, advancement within the company is based on perception, not reality.

headline: Draconian and Stressful--Run Away! Run as Fast as You CAN!!
pros: Way too few to mention
cons:
Too many to list: Cronyism.
Lay offs occur every two weeks like clockwork. It's the only thing that HR does efficiently.
This is not a research based pharmaceutical company...
Pfizer is a Merger and Acquisition machine that has zero heart
Think "The Borg" and "Assimilation" and you have a good idea of a 'nice' day at Pfizer

headline: Ability grow, but has become more and more challenging
pros: Ability to obtain great experience across many facets of work.
cons: Budget constraints has made getting things done difficult

headline: very good company
pros: huge assets and potentials for great business
cons:
Very poor talent retention actions
Poor pipline

headline: I worked at G.D. Searle which was acquired by Pfizer
pros:
Great benefits: more vacation time than most companies offer.
Higher salary than other companies
Interesting work
If you can prove your worth, easy to move up in the company
cons: Best to negotiate the highest salary before being hired. Otherwise, you'll always be at the low end of the pay scale for the position.

headline: Senior District Manager pharma bases in Pune
pros: Good people development, training is good but oflate taking a downslide
cons: Only preaches good things but practices dirty with the employees

headline: Project Manager
pros: Benefits, Contributions to improving healthcare
cons: Constant re-sizing of the organization

headline: Merge and Purge
pros: Pays well if you are a legacy employee
cons: Lots of silos, does not appreciate what it has purchased. Layed off 15,000 employees without regard to experience or value added.

headline: Pfizer doesn't value the sales force
pros: Large network, good pain drugs
cons: constant loss of benefits, always a threat of being laid off, treated like a robot, almost no opportunity for advancement

headline: My supervisor/manager micromanaged, was abusive, and more
pros: Benefits were great, but they cut  back on many.
cons:
My supervisor/manager micromanaged to the point that he was constantly in my face and was abusive.  I was non-exempt, and worked through lunch and after 5pm.  Never got paid for over-time because the non-exempt staff was told that they had to finish all their work, and it was impossible to finish by 5pm.  And, when men were hired with only a bachlors degree they usually went into management trainee programs, but most women didn't, they just remained in their positions.
Moral was horrible!  I stayed because of the benefits, medical, etc.

headline: Not a place for long-term IT career
pros:
Good benefits and salary
use of current and sometimes cutting technology
Very smart people employed there
cons:
Very difficult to be promoted if not an upper management 'favorite'
Very little promise for long-term career due to poor drug pipeline
Always the threat of layoffs across all organization

headline: not too good
pros: to grow in life as soon as possible
cons: disparity in working condition till today

headline: 5 year professional in operations, strategy and communications
pros: Culture, great people support system and real care for colleagues global security
cons: Ageism and importance of hierarchy sucks

headline: Supply chain at Pfizer
pros:
01 - Dynamic team members : possibility to implement solutions 

02 - Six sigma : Management emphasize on continuous improvement project 

03 - Community oriented : Opportunity to share experiences giving the feeling the be a part of a worldwide project

04 - Harmonization of process : Facilitate the communication with other supply chain stakeholders

05 - Awards and monthly news  : Create a sane competition environment within the supply chain (both local and worldwide)
cons:
01 - Administration difficulties : slow communication due to complex internal processes

02 - Too much separation between the operational departments (support functions) : create a bad competition between them and slower the processes

headline: Pretty good comapny to work for.
pros: Before the Pfizer acquisition of King, the company was great.  An excellent IT department and management listened
cons: After the Pfizer/King acquisition, it was difficult to get management to listen.  People left in place in jobs that weren't needed.

headline: Great time, especially during the 90's and early 2000's

headline: work culture is good but not pay master as like other.

Everything stays the same

headline: Great for Scienc
pros:
Pfizer has great resources and best technology.  Their IT capabilities are superb.
The best asset they have is talent and knowledge.

headline: In Transition
pros: Great Work- Life Balance, good benefits

headline: Pfizer, Inc. Corporate Audit Department
pros: Travel the world, network with senior executives around the globe, travel, travel and more travel.
cons: Traveling 2-3 weeks per month is very hard to manage long-term.  Burn out is extremely high.

the job responsibilities match my skill set very well, and challenging.

Groton location is not good compared to south san francisco

many lay-offs
anxious environment to work in
upper management kept changing and so did job requirements

headline: So Awesome to work for...

headline: Good company to work at! Excellent networking opportunities.

headline: Pays well but the future is bleak

headline: Pays well but the future is bleak
pros: Good pay, Madison NJ campus is nice
