Constant layoffs while CEO gets raises
Pharma industry continues to tank

headline: Senior Associate Scientist Pfizer Review
pros: Great Benefits, Flexibility, Opportunities for learning and development
cons: Typical Corporate downsides, re-organization often leaving an often unsettled or lack of job confidence feelings

headline: Big but not sure where it is going
pros:
Large company with established presence in segment
Many bright, well educated coworkers
Compensation excellent
cons:
No apparent strategic focus save stock price maintenance
Co-workers more concerned with being let go than doing job
Too fragmented with little overall strategy to guide efforts
Found many people a bit too self-centered in work and weren't too helpful in helping you if it didn't help them

headline: The biggest and most lucrative employee in the Groton, CT area.
pros: You get to work with some pretty smart folks from a variety of backgrounds. Being one of the larger employers in the area, you're not necessarily confined to a small group of folks around the water cooler and in some areas drama is at a minimum.
cons: It used to be a place where one could work their way up the ladder. That is not the case anymore. Most movement is lateral at best. As a large employer, you're a number. If you can live with that, you'll do well here.

headline: Product Manager @ Pfizer
pros:
Lots of responsibility
Ability to work in a very friendly & demanding environment
High salaries in Pharma
cons:
Hard to get things to done
Marketing is limited in pharma

headline: Attracting and burning through a lot of strong people
pros: Company is able to recruit many sharp people with brand name and above-average compensation. You get a good education in many respects.
cons: It sucks at holding onto talent but doesn't care because of the ease in recruiting more. Market is full of good ex-PFE people.

headline: I learned alot of things in Pfizer.
pros: Learn basics.If you are good at basics. We can  perform anywhere
cons: For every company up-downs will be there

headline: Great company
pros: Freedom, great products, good benefits
cons: Medicine is very restrictive to pharma companies

headline: wonderful
pros: Customer focussed & Employee friendly & System oriented organisation.
cons: Delayed decisions at times & too much cautious in decision making

headline: General Review
pros: Decent salary and great commute.
cons: Heavy handed on compliance, big brother mindset, too many processes to complete a task.

headline: Big Pharma, with lots of turn over
pros: Good Science, product driven, nice culture
cons: Too much turn over, no job security

headline: a wonderful environment, very good team with cooperation
pros: a wonderful environment, very good team with cooperation
cons: a  environment, very good team with cooperation

headline: Pfizer experience
pros:
There's freedom in general - clothing, ideas, working hours
Salary is higher than average
The company has a culture where you feel you belong
cons: Since the company is really established, everything is mostly set up, there are not many opportunities to contribute from oneself own.

headline: Manager is your lifeline at Pfizer
pros: Great projects at the "in" site.  No projects at the "out" site
cons: Imploding Pipeline.  Old projects that sucked wind, return for no apparent reason.

headline: Pfizer creates politicians not medicines
pros: Benefits, pay, nothing else, nothing else, nothing else (had to enter 5 pros)
cons: Political atmosphere, unbearable bureaucracy, best talent continues to leave, ready-fire-aim business strategy, decisions based on leaders personal interests and never around making best science decisions or even decisions in best benefit of company

headline: Below Average since Pfizer bought Wyeth
pros: Challenging work. Job constantly changes.
cons: Management clueless as to the needs of the employees.

headline: Pfizer
pros:
Good Salary
Global Opportunities
Great Benefits
Multiple Locations
Multiple Divisions
Supportive Leadership
Advancement Opportunities
Training and Development
Cross Functional Teams
cons: Company is currently downsizing and restructing the business to focus on human over the counter and pharmaceuticals only.  This is a change from the previous platform which included animal health and capsules.

headline: it is okay, improvement is the key
pros: nice working environment and talented colleagues
cons: equal opportunities, compensation and benefits shall be provided, talent planning is no where near where it should be

headline: it is tremendous
pros: i m proud to be pfizerite
cons: low wages basic wages are also very low

headline: Liked working for Wyeth, hated working for Pfizer.
pros: People I worked with were good people, and use of technology was cutting edge for big pharma.
cons: Pfizer really couldn't care less about its employees.  After they took over Wyeth, I had two phone conversations with my new boss in over a year, the first of which was to inform me that I would be losing my job sometime that year.  Didn't return calls or emails after that.

headline: Big company but take less care of people, talent
pros: Big company with string brands
cons: politics and too many processes, likes to do communication which simply an "advertising"

headline: Like my job, the company...not so much anymore.
pros: Good salary, still decent benefits, good work/life balance
cons:
Highly political.  Lots of groups with overlapping responsibilities.
Under constant reorganization creating a very disruptive work environment.  Good people are leaving if they haven't left already.
Lack of transparency in promotions.
Terrible communication from senior management.  They say they respect people, but they really don't.
Struggling to change their culture - please no more slogans.

headline: Good money, lot of politics
pros: Excellent compensation, good networking and information sharing across sites. I enjoyed working for Pfizer and the many great employees.
cons: Poor communication, top down management style. Politics often plays roles in position filling/creating rather than knowledge or ability.

headline: A job that paid the bills for 9 1/2 years
pros: Good money even for entry level techs.  Three weeks vacation right out of the gate.  Great prescription plan.
cons: Different messages sent throughout the managment levels.  Unfavorable works schedules.  Lacks a sense of pride and unity.  Very much an "us" vs "them" environment between management and workers.

headline: Program Data Manager
pros: Ability to work from home and travel is still supported. There is cohesion among treatment programs as this is necessary to keep the program consistent.
cons: Very unorganized, unsupportive, stressful. Processes, documentation, standards, templates, etc. constantly change and you're required to continually go back and review the same documentation over and over instead of going forward from the time of the change. Most studies are long-term and you are responsible to address documents from colleagues who preceded you on the study, many of whom no longer work there. This happens every couple weeks. VERY stressful, demanding, and time-consuming.

headline: great potential but poor leadership
pros: Innovative and massive scale and reach - ability to address real health problems
cons: beuracracy and disconnect between different divisions

headline: Bureaucratic
pros: Competitive Salary. Big player in pharmaceuticals. Multiple options for career paths. Predictable in most respects. Comfortable way to earn a living.
cons: I got the sense that the functional organizations exist primarily to ensure their own survival. Pfizer, like all other major pharmas is attempting to re-invent itself and to spring from its past with a new beginning in emerging markets. I have little faith that Pfizer, with its immense weight of passive-aggressive functional immobility will prove to be sufficiently lean to thrive in the new world of true competition.

headline: It was a Great Company to work for..
pros: People were highly talented both in HO and field force, culture was professional, lots of learning was there.
cons: Market evolved but Pfizer India didnt. Lack of good people in sr management  and even the sales and marketing is very weak. pfizer values are put on stake by some. Lots of beaurocarcy. No proper plan while launching branded generic, launching 20 - 30 branded generics over a period of 2 years is Not Pfizer India style.

headline: A great company that took a wrong turn.....
pros: Great team, co-workers; sense of empowerment
cons: Once they started outsourcing, they went wild - staff became disengaged, lost vested interest, always fearful for their job.  Philosophy of the company completely changed.

headline: Terrible micromanaging culture
pros: They pay pretty good salary
cons: Micromanaged at every turn. Process is more important than sales.

headline: Pfizer India - It is no longer the company it used to be.
pros: It was a great organization couple of years back. Excellent people, excellent environment, very understanding employees, excellent training ground, excellent value systems.
cons: All the pros are the things of the past. Now, everything has reversed.

headline: Working for this company was exhausteing.
pros: Salaries, benefits and .... that's about it.
cons: Where do I begin.  Very few people have the fortitude to stay the course with all the internal competition and fighting for survival.  Culture is antithesis of what they say they want..  People are not engaged, creative risk taking, collaborative, or transparent because they are always worried about making mistakes,  failing, and ultimately getting laid off.

headline: It is a great company overall. Lots of fantastic people, at least in the sales and marketing end.
pros: Great company. Diverse workforce. Lots of opportunity to move up and around at least in sales.
cons: Sales could be demoralizing at times. Lots of extra work required outside of regular business hours.

headline: A Company in decline for the past few years
pros: Work-life balance is good for the most part
cons: Compensation is poor. Promotions not always transparent

headline: This IS the biggest company in the world.
pros:
- regardless where you are located you can feel that this is a huge organization, the international matrix is is complex that it is hard to learn it
- good benefits
- good products
cons:
- promotion of people not necessarily based on merit
- significant rotation
- slow in decision making due to its size

headline: I love my work, but I'm not always in love with my company.
pros: Friendly office atmosphere and a welcoming atitutde towrds new ideas. Continuous improvement is encouraged and sponsored regularly. The benefits packages are of the best offered in the corporate environment. A social, inclusive environment which may extend past the "work friends" relationship.
cons: Many shifts in resource/departmental organization which at times paralyzed real work from being accomplished. Internal political maneuvering is common at the upper and mid-upper levels, sometimes to the detriment of the those reporting up.

headline: My experience at Pfizer was ok.  They constantly reorganize and are always laying people off.
pros: The work/life balance is good there.  Pfizer offers a compressed work week for 6 months every year so that your week ends by noon on Fridays.  Plus Pfizer encourages you to work from home.
cons: Changes everyday, every week.  You go to work everyday wondering if you will be the next one being let go.  It's an ongoing reorganization there and every month there are lay offs.

headline: In transition
pros: Great company legacy, strong mission, good pay, benefits, work/life, and many nice talented people.
cons: Variability in capability of senior management, often too consensus driven, pockets of dysfunction can be extraordinarily toxic.

headline: Overall Very Good Employer
pros: If you work at Pfizer you can expect:  Structured work environment, Great products, Decent Budget, Good intell data, Great Reputation from doctors
cons: As with all companies of Pfizer's size at times you are nothing more than a number.  To succeed at Pfizer it is best to be non-opinionated and follow the scripts.

headline: Good coworkers, interesting projects, but strategy changes are too frequent
pros: Talented coworkers, interesting projects, more resources that allow looking at many aspects of drug development that might not be available at smaller companies.  Most people are happy with how their own local departments are run.
cons: There are frequent reorganizations and changes in overall strategy due to higher level turnover in leadership.  One significant example is that for the last several CEOs the company has frequently changed its position on whether diversification of the company is good, or whether the company should spin off non-core units to focus on patented pharmaceuticals.

headline: Good!
pros: Respect for people, regardless background, race, culture, and social level.
cons: Expectation always very high, and aggresive.

headline: A Look at Pfizer
pros: health benefits, personal and career development
cons: work life balance, examine the needs of the people, and why people are leaving the company

headline: Good experience to grown professionally and personally
pros: Exposure to different cultures and steady paycheck
cons: Emotional climate dramatic at times

headline: My experience with Pfizer was mainly positive but has challenges as with any large company.
pros:
Excellent benefits. 
Excellent training and tools to help you advance in the company.
cons:
Extremely corporate and bureaucratic not readily open to innovative ideas. 
Very slow to change. 
Say they care about employees but we are really just a number.
Wants you to focus on job as priority rather than personal life. You have to work hard to keep balance.

headline: Open company looking for diversity in knowledge
pros: Allow training on a wide range of methods and actively seek to train employees with tools to make them successful
cons: No cons that I can think of.

headline: It was a very toxic yet fulfilling workplace.
pros: Good health benefits. Incentive package is okay. People seem to look up to you when they learn you work for Pfizer.
cons: Toxic. An endless cycle of work, work, work.

headline: My life in Pfizer
pros: Large opportunities due to size of company. Good pipeline vis a vis other major MNCs
cons: Limited opportunities at the country level. Important to move into a global/ regional role in order to leverage any opportunities . On a current cost cutting spree

headline: Big Pharma
pros: Top training ..you will know your products
cons: E-detailing is not really the best way to sell.

headline: Regulatory
pros: submit the file to register, new, or update products information
cons: a huge opportunity to get global experience

headline: Awesome.
pros: For the learners its like NDA for a trainee cadet.Its one of the very few organizations that will give value to How to generate the business rather how much u have generated.
cons: Pcckage could be much better.

headline: Awesome.
pros: For the learners its like NDA for a trainee cadet.Its one of the very few organizations that will give value to How to generate the business rather how much u have generated.
cons: Pcckage could be much better.

headline: Submit submissions to the FDA
pros: Great pay and benefits working at Pfizer
cons: They give to many jobs out to other countries

headline: 2 Years at a Big Pharma Company
pros: Good salary and benefits. Twice a year weekly Sales Conference with all Swiss staff in high end hotels, all costs covered. Met a lot of nice and friendly people during my stint.
cons:
Due to the nature of the products the company manufactures and markets, the studies used to illustrate their supposed higher efficiency and thus convince MDs and other opinion leaders to prescribe the drugs, are not always reliable and, frequently, the figures used in them are statistical outliers.
This practice however, is not exclusive to this company.

headline: Good company going through a rough patch financially.
pros: This company treats high performers well, and still offers a good benefits package along with educational assistance.  The company is innovating in some areas, and is constantly looking to redefine itself in response to the changing industry.
cons: Staff reductions have placed ever-increasing amounts of work on fewer and fewer employees.  Guidance by senior management seems short-sighted, and an unsustainable level of pressure has been placed on the staff to cut costs and increase production.

headline:
For the sane at Pfizer is not the place to be in.
For the insane at Pfizer, it is a time of your life.
pros: High salary and little work
cons: Reapply for your job every 2-3 year

headline: Too much cronyism
pros: name recognition is good in the industry
cons: Need for focus on employees and stop restructuring

headline: Interesting insight into a Pharma giant
pros:
Many research areas with many industry experts
Variety of opportunities for scientists
cons: Corporate culture does not foster innovation and risk-taking

headline: Running around looking busy without much to show for it
pros: Solid Marketing and business company
cons: Relentless reorganizations, too many fiefdoms, paranoid director mgrs., severe lack of civility in colleague interpersonal relationships

headline: Going downhill
pros:
Opportunity to learn
Willingness to allow newcomers take on additional responsibilities
cons:
"Do more with less"
No work-life balance - I want the results yesterday!
Inexperienced management

headline: Former glory, Future Unknown.
pros: Large company resources and recognition.
cons: Uncertain future due to the diminishing importance of sales force. Policy pressures changing the entire landscape.

headline: Happy to be looking for new opportunities
pros:
Flexible work hours
Ability to work remotely
Nice salary and adequate benefits
cons:
Bad culture and work environment
No accountability for failure
No innovation and no new technology being implemented

headline: Run for your life
pros: If you are lucky to get a decent boss, hang onto them for your life... because there are  A LOT of bad managers.
cons:
Very political.  
Management lies, a lot.

headline: Waiting for a turnaround
pros: Pfizer was a great company to work for in the past, but difficult times have changed the environment.  They had fairly good technical talent and funding to do some very interesting projects.  The size of the company provided financial resources that weren't available in many other environments.  Comp was also above average.
cons: IT budgets were cut more than 33% in 2012.  Layoffs are so abundant that it is extremely difficult to get anything done.  Innovative work is extremely limited in these difficult times.  Political postering and bad behavior have increased under the recent financial pressure.

headline: world no 1 pharma on sale base.
pros: working in pfizer is very relax as compare to other pharmas because all the products are so much established.
cons: pfizer is a combination of 4 pharmas ie park davis,wyeth,pharmacia .

headline: excellent learning opportunity
pros: The fast paced environment coupled with the available resources makes this organization an excellent place to learn and grow
cons: politics and levels of management make action slow to come

headline: i have beenworking for for pfizer to work its an awesome place to work people are friendly with culture
pros: Culture, Scientific oriented company and its the worlds no.1 pharma company
cons: less packages when compared with other MNCs

headline: Only interested in the bottom line.
pros: Good pay and benefits. Good work life balance.
cons: Pfizer is very top heavy and decisions are extremely slow.

headline: Pfizer ...a big family
pros: Its the biggest pharmaceutical and research based company in the world and working for a company like that really adds to your profile.There is a LOT to learn from the company and my colleagues and superiors, who are a storehouse of knowledge and experience.Working for Pfizer develops you as a person.The company works on its employee`s development through various training modules and programs.
cons: Expectation is  high, do not join this company if you are not willing to give a 100%

headline: Going downhill fast
pros:
Still in business of saving lives.
Smart, committed employees for the most part.
Good compensation and benefits.
cons:
Senior executives who care only about their own ambitions.
Lots of lip service about colleague engagement, innovation and diversity; not actual practice.
Extremely political environment.
Lots of cutbacks that affect only the rank and file; senior execs still living large with many perks.
Lots of inequity in promotion and compensation.

headline: Was a good place to work
pros: The salaries were good, but they are looking to reduce
cons: Constant firing and many people unhappy.  Management is disconnected from workforce and is self-serving.  Once upon a time was a great place to work where people really cared, now it is just people collecting paychecks.

headline: Good Science Despite Chaos
pros:
People generally good to wirk with (some exceptions)
Salary
cons:
organization shake-up = job uncertainty
Performance Management

headline: okay okay till now
pros: good experience as a first company.
cons: now a days employees are not taken care of.

headline: Excellent Company
pros: Good Working Conditions, Flex time available, Health Clinic on Site, Day Care available, Good Smart people to work with
cons: Company is in re-structuring mode, so morale is a bit low

headline: Great pay; great benefits
pros: Pays well. Excellent benefits and 401k matching.
cons: Wage gap is evident. Company doesn't hesitate to close down plants in the U.S. and ship product to be marketed/produced/packaged/etc. overseas.

headline: great
pros: A person can learn things in a better way. the word Politics more often.
cons: this is process oriented company not people, no more how hard you work if you don't give performance every time then you're done.

headline: The pay can't be beat in SECT
pros: The pay and benefits are the absolute best in the area. Like any large, multinational company experiences will vary with department and direct supervisor. The experience of working here really IS what one makes of it.
cons:
Pfizer is a large company, and change comes slowly. Often when change does come, it's the result of the work of a large committee of various departments and the change does not always make sense. 

If you enjoy working in a scrappy environment, or working to move a company toward #1, look elsewhere.

headline: statistical programmer
pros: Very flexible work enviroment. Great place to work. Good benefits and salary. great opportunities to excel in your career.
cons: Too many organizational changes at too many times. By time you settle in the direction that the orgaination is going, changes happen again.

headline: A good place to work but difficult to get things done
pros: Large organization long term career plan, if you are able to make it through all the cuts constantly happening in the organization.
cons: They have been in a state of re organization for the last 6 years.  They cut back on people and jobs every year until recently now cutting every 6 months.  Difficult environment to grow and feel valued.  Not a good time to join Pfizer.

headline: Good place to work great people
pros: People, work/life balance, clean environment, understanding manager, reasonable benefits, great people and good management team.
cons: Pay too many business units and not enough interaction between them especially when changes are being made.

headline: Changing...not sure if its stable
pros: Paid well --excellent training- flexible
cons:
No longer offering pension-
Not sure managment knows what direction they are going in.
Lay offs every year

headline: Great company, unstable industry
pros: Fabulous benefits, high-quality individuals as employees, fair treatment. If you are interested in pharma this is still a great (though not as great as it once was) company to work for.
cons: The message for the past several years has been 'Do more with less.' This isn't necessarily always a bad thing, but sometimes can be. People are asked to do too much, the company is sitting on piles of money and not retaining people where they are sometimes necessary. Pharma is constantly going through LOE situations, it is insanely highly-regulated, and can be unstable. Prepare to wonder at least once a year if you will be laid off at some point that year - sales or not.

headline: Pfizer is a nice place to work
pros:
The ability to work from home as a perm employee is a plus, at least 2 days a week.
Summer/Pfizer fridays start and end with daylight savings time (Mar-Nov), work about an extra 45 a day and leave at 1p on friday.
Big company with decent benefits, very flexible work arrangements.
cons:
Impersonal, depending on what site you work in and the dept, difficult to interact with people from other depts. 
Few private workspaces in some sites.
Raises are not great, no bonus at some levels, unlike at other companies where nearly everyone gets some kind of bonus or incentive
Own it culture doesn't work as there is no real incentive o work any harder than you have to as there is nothing to work towards as promotions seem few and far between.

headline: Competitive, rewarding, training is excellent; very bureaucratic especially in upper management; highly regulated now
pros: Pay, benefits, time-off. Training is outstanding. Direct managers are for the the most part understanding personally and professionally.  Pfizer takes care of those who take care of Pfizer.
cons: Upper management seems out of touch and getting local work done can be very bureaucratic at times. Industry is highly regulated now.

headline: The cost cutting measures and bad management decisions make it difficult.
pros: Remnant management left from Wyeth makes the job tolerable as well as my hard working coworkers.  It gets more and more difficult to think of reasons that make this company a good one to work for, at least in my position and location.  Senior site management is open to suggestions and promotes education and innovation.
cons: Flattening has reduced opportunity for advancement.  Reduction in force has reduced opportunity even for lateral movement.  If you're in work related to manufacturing, you're stuck where you are.  Layoffs have become a yearly occurrence.  Management is making stupid decisions.  Want a new laptop?  Tough luck this year, even if your equipment is slower than a snail.  Also, layoff all the people in manufacturing who know what they're doing.  When things fall into chaos, hire all new people who have no idea what they're doing who use up all the time of the few people left who do because they're busy training the new hires.  Then scratch your head and wonder why everything's going to hell.  Introduce all kinds of new systems for purchase requisitions, documents and other things then sit back and watch all the frustration when people try to learn several new things at once.   Pfizer is doing a great job of ruining our integrity while encouraging us to "Own It."

headline: Good place to start your career
pros: Pfizer has a strong learning environment for someone starting out in their career. If you find the right mentor, this could be an excellent opportunity to get ahead of the pack. They have excellent benefits all around.
cons: I feel that biannual review process was not always the best - there tended to be a lot of "curve fitting" within an function/division rather than rating someone based on his/her accomplishments against goals and merits. With so many major M&As over the past decade (Warner-Lambert, Pharmacia, Wyeth, King), the company is still struggling to get all of the integration done.

headline: My experience was very positive until the last 3 years when Senior Management lacked focus.
pros: My co-workers in the trenches are generally sincerely dedicated professionals who want to make a difference in the world and contribute to making medicines. Every day they look for ways to improve how things are done.
cons: Senior management does not have a sustainable vision for the future of the company. They need to engage the scientists and support staff better, but they are not comitted to long-term successful R&D.

headline: Tremendous opportunities, but constant pressure to work harder and reduce costs (e.g., cut headcount).
pros: Pfizer is a large, global company with many opportunities to work and travel internationally.  They continue to generate tons of cash which gives them flexibility and opportunities to buy other firms.  They do offer very flexible work arrangements and you are expected to work from whereever you are are.  It's not always necessary to come to the office.
cons:
Their sheer size makes it easy to get lost.
The constant acquisitions followed by downsizing puts pressure on everyone to perform.    Laying people off has become a core competency as people are layed off in waves.

headline: Restructuring mayhem
pros:
Great substance and interesting issues
Good pay
Good benefits
cons:
Downsizing 
Chaotic 
Stressful
Unrealistic targets and expectations
Constantly looking to reassess and find places to cut costs

headline: Fantastic
pros: Very positive company that has great training
cons: too large for my liking

headline: Competitive environment made harder as people are afraid of being laid off
pros: Huge international company with a strong history of outstanding marketing.  The benefits are excellent.  If they can get the business model sorted and a stronger pipeline it will be a great place again.  And I believe they will - but it will take a few years.
cons: Tough and depressing environment at the moment.  Setbacks in products and LOE amongst key players makes it difficult internally. Morale is at an all time low because of the job eliminations - people are asked to take on more work with less resources - ergo it is tough for people to feel generous with their time and help.

headline: not good, lay offs
pros: a big company, reputable, worldwide
cons: out source everything, no job security

headline: It is a good scientific experience
pros: Excellent scientists, resources and benefits
cons: The expansions did not bring a positive outcome. No Lessons learned

headline: Positive experience until 2010, since then radical staffing cuts to make numbers for Wall St.
pros: Large corporation, plenty of opportunity to move around within the company.  Corporate presence worldwide enables opportunity for global travel and interaction with multiple cultures.
cons: Pipeline stalled, substantial layoffs since 2010 with no end in sight.  Senior management does not state a target for layoffs which leaves everyone insecure about job security.

headline: saticefy
pros: respect and experience and organized
cons: salaries and less courses and transportation and some managers are stoper

headline: no opportunities
pros: Good team to work with
cons: No body cares about IT other than IT

headline: It was alright
pros: Good name on the resume
cons: Lack of job security since the end of the Lipitor Patent

headline: Nice company to work in until the recent change in management
pros: Big MNC. Helpful colleagues. Nice opportunities to move around.
cons: Change in management and changes in the organisation is too often and drastic. Work processes keeps changing and its very hard to keep up with such changes. Support to do work is getting lesser and lesser as people are more keen in the fight for survival. Pretty sad to see the company in such a state.

headline: Satisfying
pros: Colleagues are knowledgeable and supportive. Colleagues work very hard to achieve objectives.
cons: Business plan process is more complicated than needed. Priorities of different groups that normally collaborate, are not integrated. Loss of efficiencies due to overlap/repetition.

headline: Extremely satisfying and definitely would recommend to my friends
pros:
Great senior management.
Awesome work ethic and culture
Pride and respect in being with the company
Respect in the job market while looking for a change.
cons:
Focused work.. less cross exposure
Opportunities for internal promotion are complex and relatively less
Change of verticals not a common phenomenon

headline: Decent job with decent salary in a very decent environment
pros: Stability, benefit packages. Supervisors tend to be very comprehensive about time and personal life.
cons: Some employees are obsolete and recycled with in the company which takes away opportunity for other potential employees.

headline: A good company to work for in the Pharma world
pros: One can balance work and life easily
cons: Depending on the job your commute

headline: roller coaster
pros: Great company with many many intelligent employees.
cons: Job instability due to constant cuts

headline: Multinational environment, open for career moves but there are differences in countries in terms of work environments.
pros: Multinational, lots of job opportunities, and well paid with respect to other industries. Furthermore, the strong history of the company gives you the confidence, and prestige.
cons: Pfizer is a hierarchical organization and sometimes it takes too long to get things done rapidly and effectively. In addition to that, there is an increasing cost saving operations in the company which puts more work on every employee.

headline: Great company and fully engaged
pros:
Lots of options for many projects with rewarding goals.

With the Lipitor layoffs, it's hard to find an opening to get hired.
cons: Very big and sometimes hard to find resources.

headline: If paychecks and good benefit are what you are looking for, this is the right place
pros:
- good benefit and compensation 
- very little workload and very little work being done
- onsite gym and flexible working hours
- helping your manager renovating his house will get you a long way
cons:
- all politics and no reward for hard work
- be careful with the HR. They could lure you back from cancer treatment and lay you off
- limited career growth for minorities and women in general
- severance package getting worse over the years

headline: Satisfactory
pros: The Salary, the people, the products that help the world
cons: Inconsistent management styles throughout the organization.

headline: Uninspiring
pros: -decent amount of time off,  good work/life balance (depending on your job title/responsibility/team).  My work schedule rarely interferes with my personal life.
cons: very unstable environment.  the atmosphere is very conservative and non-innovative.  the bonus structure is non-existent if you are below Sr. management level...

headline: Great place to work if you don't mind if you don't take it too seriously!
pros: Great benefits with mostly great people.
cons: If you get stuck in a territory that doesn't perform, you will never be promoted. It was very interesting that people who were in the same geographical areas would always rise straight to the top.  The "Vacant Family" was often very successful...meaning, even if the territory was empty, it would somehow be #1 EVERY year!

headline: mixed
pros: colleagues, summer hours, at the time :ALL prescriptions were free with healthcare  coverage
cons:
constant change.  
unstable environment.  
constantly laying off good employees
questionable business decisions
the higher on the 'food chain' the better the work life, salary, etc.
lowly staff got stomped on

headline: Lots of opportunity and talent but also a lot of politics and hierarchies
pros: Work/life balance (half day Fridays, working from home, vacation time), smart and talented people, opportunity to travel, opportunity to learn about different parts of the business.
cons: Organization too large and it is impossible to know everyone in your own department, politics, strict adherence to the corporate heirarchy, not much visibility of the leadership teams, major decisions made at the top that are not thought through that colleagues are accountable for, every project is complex due to the complexity of the organization, rolling layoffs.

headline: Good place to start
pros:
Great Benefits
Good Learning
Good Brand
cons: Flexibility will go a long way from Management to Employers

headline: Good people, terrible location
pros: The people are great, lots of young recent graduates, friendly atmosphere. Good food in the canteen, lots of cafes around the site.
cons: Sandwich, Kent. You're in the middle of nowhere, literally can not walk to anything except other Pfizer buildings and fields. Canterbury is basically the only town in the area. The buildings are all those new 'high tech' complex type constructions, that have zero soul. Very high turnover of employees. I think many people were on ~2 year contracts.

headline: It is a good place to work - understanding that the pharma industry is changing.
pros: great people, good salary and benefits
cons: You could be "impacted" at any time.  Constant change in programs, processes and people.

headline: above average
pros:
good salary as compared to others in the industry
Respectable company
Good working environment
support of senior management
Team spirit
organised
flexible location
cons:
sales is very Competitive
show results and prove yourself
compensation is team oriented.
too much supervision , but only in some cases.

headline: In constant flux, but a great place to work.
pros: Pfizer encourages a healthy work/life balance.
cons: The benefits get a little less beneficial each year, and everyone is always at risk to be let go.

headline: Chaotic and Unfullfilling
pros:
Big company, good name to include on your cv
Too challenging to complete a task teaches you to handle very difficult situations
Ability to take initiatives
cons:
Too much politics
No recognition for hard and good work
No direction
Poor management and no respect from arrogant leadership team
Too many reorganizations and restructuring leading to insecurities of the employees

headline: A Very Big Ship
pros:
#1 Pharma in the world.  
Excellent benefits
Innovative
Values and Respect for People
Opportunities and Flexibilities
Recognized  and respected leader in the industry and communities
cons:
Constant change and restructuring
Constant mergers
Right hand does not know what left hand is doing
Red tape, hard to get work done
Lack of Agility
Declining budgets/resources

headline: I enjoyed a lot
pros: management level are nice and caring about employees. providing good training . flexible hours. learned a lot from work. good place to work.
cons: lots of contract position, but it happens to lots of pharma. sometimes overtime work, generally not too much downsides here.

headline: A decade of constant turmoil and strife
pros: Generous compensation and benefits, at least as of now (although benefits and compensation are being curtailed).  Some talented co-workers and top notch scientists but most of the top talent is leaving because of recent changes.
cons: No clear direction from Sr. Management.  A chaotic environment where urgent projects are cancelled without notice, sites are closed and colleagues relocated yearly, years of work are discarded and each wave of re-organization lowers morale further.  Positions are often created, filled and then eliminated within a 6-10 month time frame.  Pfizer has a long history of hiring people into sites that close within a week of their start date.  The leadership has proven time and again to be completely untrustworthy. Whatever they say, believe the opposite.  Beware working for this company.

headline: Very Disappointing
pros: paycheck & benefits, cafeteria & gym (limited)
cons: limited vision, lack of direction, addicted to outsourcing

headline: Not what it used to be
pros:
work / home balance
health insurance
cons:
too top heavy
lacks communication and working together

headline: It is changing for the worse
pros: Good infrastructure and resources. Many smart scientists who want to contribute and help patients. Used to be a great place to learn, have fun at work and make a career out of it.
cons: Frequent and mindless reorganization that has been extremely disruptive and demotivating. No clear leadership, no direction, unhealthy internal competition, low moral.

headline: disconnected
pros:
flexible work schedule 
Local management was great.
cons:
Senior management disconnected from its employees
Seems to lack directions at the employee level.

headline: An interesting company to intern at, but don't expect much else
pros:
Prestige. People know the company.
Employees. Very polite, very nice to interns, competent, smart.
Responsibility given to interns. I worked on documents that went all the way to the top of the company.
Nice site.
Willing to give vacation time to interns.
Company name is fantastic for resume when applying elsewhere.
cons:
Mergers and general industry trend means pressure for jobs.
IT is messy in some regards and slow. Mergers don't help this.
Rigid and you can't disclose much of your work outside of the company (even in business units). Comes with the industry, but...
No compensation beyond salary. Not even paying July 4th (done in 2010).
Tons of contractors and consultants over real employees. Between the first point and this, expecting conversion to a job after the internship is unlikely.
Referrals matter a lot to internships. Most of the interns have a parent at VP level or above.

headline: Great place to work
pros: pay structure, raises, innovation, culture, teamwork, senior management
cons: grade levels, office open environment

headline: Great experience
pros:
-flexible
-interesting work
-great people
-Pfizer has a very global business attitude and I enjoyed that
cons: -negative atmosphere due to many layoffs

headline: Ok
pros: Multinational Company for good resume, good starting pay, co-workers are nice to work with, some are extremely helpful and efficient, good work-life balance.
cons: Unstable company, constant business changes, lack of direction. So much changes to the global team that nobody really knows the history of the project they are handling.

headline: Lots of bureaucracy and politics, and inefficiencies in processes between front line and top line
pros: great benefits - 401k, health, car, cell phone, and corporate credit card
cons:
Militaristic style...pressure from upward management gets pushed down to all levels of management and to the sales representatives creating a military like atmosphere.

Lots of tests, unnecessary reports, and inefficiencies that go hand and hand with a corporation that's too big.

headline: Pfustrating
pros: Facilities, Professionalism, Compensation, some very talented people
cons: Management, arrogance of leadership, lack of training, lack of career mobility

headline: very unsupportive environment
pros: pay, projects, cafeteria, parking, coffee bars
cons: culture, career development, people management, lack of leadership

headline: very unsupportive environment
pros: pay, projects, cafeteria, parking, coffee bars
cons: culture, career development, people management, lack of leadership

headline: Pfizer is OK
pros: The best reason for working at Pfizer is the numerous products available and ability to make a difference in the world.  Pfizer is large enough that there are many site locations.
cons: Too big of a company.  The balance between money and customer focus frequently appears to lean towards the financials.  But, when the company is about ready to lose several major patents, it can be understood why.

headline: overall positive considering the industry and co. is shrinking fast.
pros: Industry best training, compensation & benefits. good work/life balance.
cons:
Little upward mobility in sales unless willing to relocate to NY or Collegeville, PA.
Poor long-term strategies for growth based out of desperation vs IP growth.

headline: Great company to work for
pros: Opportunity to work on and contribute to large enterprise scale initiatives
cons: There's a very Tall Hierarchy.

headline: Great
pros: Friendly co-workers, good work/life balance
cons: Job was stressful at times.....very busy, short staffed

headline: Absolute disaster, worst company to work for ever, treat you like a slave and they just buy out everybody.
pros: You get a decent salary and a company car other than that it is nice to be solo in the field and have freedom however with pfizer watching your every move you really dont have freedom
cons: Management, unstable, bad attitudes, no teamwork whatsoever, bad bad company and they layoff every 5 seconds dont even think to apply here you will waste your time

headline: Was a good place to work, now no more due to outsourcing & less money
pros:
Good opportunity to grow and do different things. 
Excellent people to work with who are committed to doing a good job.
Lots of opportunity to learn and doing new things.
No micro management, good mid level managers.
cons:
They are cutting deep and to the bone.
Lots of jobs are outsourced.
No more funding for new technologies and learning. Keep doing the same age old stuff.
Less people and more work pressure.
Facing huge budget cut due to loss of exclusively

headline: Good.
pros: Flexible schedule and ability to work from home.
cons: Moving to more of a contractor employment model as opposed to hiring direct employees.

headline: Recruits top people, but the organizational chemistry is lacking.
pros:
Overall Purpose
Reputation
Good comprehensive comp package
cons:
Selfish leadership
Ever changing organization 
Poor team work

headline: It was a good experience overall
pros: Decent benefits package, upward mobility exists, good salary rate, a large variety of potential jobs, and internal mobility across disciplines.
cons: Pfizer's been hitting a rough patch since the end of Lipitor, so the sense of job security is not the greatest. It's a relatively bureaucratic corporation, so you'll have to deal with the politics of something that size.

headline: Good.
pros: Pfizer is a good place to grow.
cons: Constant Reorganization within Pfizer.  Makes staying at one job hard.

headline: fair
pros: benefits,  401 k my manager was good
cons: poor communiction lack of trust of people

headline: Terrible job security, layoffs constantly.
pros:
OK pay
Good paper towels 
Freedom to work at your own pace
Now I'm just typing to satisfy the 20 word minimum
Pfizer GROTON is bad. Pfizer anywhere else may be ok
cons:
Not sure how long you'll be there. Pretty much month to month
Everyone is scared for their jobs
Somber atmosphere
Everyone is looking for jobs elsewhere 
Hard work doesnt get noticed by management
If they're gonna lay you off, they will. It doesn't matter how hard you work

headline: Benefits, people and industry reputation
pros:
Good reputation
Decent Benefits
Interesting programs to help employees grow
cons:
Everyone seems like a clone 
Diversity does not seem to be a priority
Too big... hard to shine as a top performer

headline: Short...
pros: Pfizer provides a great compensation and incentives package...I worked in IT - the core business strategies were definitely known.
cons: A LOT of outsourcing...teams are no longer co-located - making much of the collaboration done in a virtual format..barely any budget allotted for IT...the company pipeline is not looking good...R&D was cut..

headline: Great opportunities -- lots of downsizing
pros: Great opportunies to work on challenging projects
cons: Continual downsizing and unstable environments.

headline: Great place to Intern if you want great access to UCSD while working as well as great pay and matching 401k.
pros: Invests into their student interns both financially with good pay and matching 401k.  They pay according to the number of credits you have completed at University, so I was paid at a senior salary from the beginning.  We were able to have security shuttle us to UCSD from work and back again so you didn't have to pay for an expensive parking permit.  They had a little training program to show you how drugs are approved.  They had a company store where you could buy Pfizer consumer products for cheap, but since then they have sold those to J&J.  Greater location with Happy Hour every Friday with a good selection of beer, good pizza, wings, quesadilla.
cons: If you work there long enough like any other job, you will start to have repetitive tasks, which can be alright given you are an intern who is there only part time.  However, if you have a good boss they can help you use top of the line equipment to automate certain tasks.  There is some decent mentorship of trying to do independent projects as well as normal job functions.

headline: Company is dysfunctional.  Most employees focus on their own personal agendas, rather than what's good for Pfizer.
pros:
smart employees
big budgets for some departments
cons:
siloed
info is power, so no one talks to anyone else

headline: Career Satisfying
pros:
Work Life Balance
Colleagues are great to work with
cons: Promotions often not based on merit

headline: Rewarding and good training ground for pharmaceutical sales
pros: Great training.  Excellent benefits and good starting salary.
cons: Job stability even when you are a performer.  Decreasing options to advance.

headline: Once a fulfilling experience, environment shift to extreme cost-cutting has brought pain
pros:
Reasonable compensation and great benefits (although they are taking things away every year)
International exposure
Is a good name for your resume
cons:
Too political
Very bearucratic and slow to make decisions
Ineffective integration of Wyeth (2009) acquistion
Unwillingness to spend money on finance systems leads to mundane and boring work
Overworked
Constant layoffs with no plan in place for transitioning work
Extremely low employee morale
No guidance from senior management
Uncollaborative team (possibly due to job security concerns)

headline: Good
pros: Benefits ans salay and different areas and products
cons: too few people for all the work needed to do. i.e. Overwork

headline: Great stepping stone company for your career, recent move to boston may bring positive change.
pros:
Great Benefits/pay
Excellent work/life balance
Plenty of opportunities to grow professionally for management
R&D seems to be heading in the right direction with the recent move to Boston to be closer to academia.
Very open environment both personally and professionally.
cons:
Not enough opportunities for growth for associates in the company
very politically driven when it comes to promotions
Less emphasis on R&D and more emphasis on Procurement. R&D is more of a show for investors than source for future products.
Seems that outsourcing is becoming their business model of choice

headline: Interesting
pros:
Stimulating business environment and high engagement
Flexibility in working arrangements 
Salary and other compensation is good with great tools to assist in your work (i.e information sources, IT apps, ect)
cons:
Change is constant and highly disruptive. This makes for an environment that lacks structure with clear roles and responsibilities
Make sure you watch your back 
You must be able to create "Cool" Power-point Slides

headline: Exciting, satisfying, and stressful
pros: motivated and enthusiastic peers, co-operative environment, collaborative culture,  excellent benefits, flexbile work schedule, intellectual freedom,  some great managers, makes efforts to improve engagement
cons: seemingly constant layoffs, poor communication, slow decision-making, long wait for resources at times, hesistant to adapt new ideas, lack of clarity in application of organizational strategy at the ground level.

headline: A big company that takes pretty good care of its employees.
pros:
It is a big company with lots of resources.  
There can be opportunity to advance if that is what you want.
Pfizer is a company that has pretty good respect in the healthcare field.
cons:
It is a big company in where sometimes the 'left hand' doesn't know what the 'right hand' is doing.
Innovation and nimlbeness are not strong suits of Pfizer.

headline: Challenging
pros: World class company, good reputation, Outstanding training and mentorship, few good managers, young and dynamic sales team, Look forward to YBMs
cons: Ridiculous targets, poor compensation, unbalanced product portfolio, poor maintenance of client list, poor market penetration in some regions, unreasonable demands, management has lost sight of their market goals

headline: Satisfied but could be a lot better
pros: compensation and benefist are fair, nothing extraordinary but fair.  Professional growth is generally available to most people, but you need to show initiative as well.
cons: Too much change in the past 10 years with no end likely in site.  Still somewhat top heavy with respect to management and career growth can be an issue.

headline: Cautionly Optimistic it will become a fair and good place to work
pros: Industry, Product, and Labor intensive to be profitable in the years to come....
cons: Communication with mid-level supervisors needs to be better along with more Employer transparency on delicate issues.

headline: Still a mess but on the right track
pros: Well-respected, company is moving in the right direction, compensation is very good, really smart people
cons: Middle-management competency is variable, opportunities sometimes provided to a manager's inner circle, drive to hire external talent without always regarding experienced employees
